intro: [WRONG START] Alostylis, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow composite flowers. These plants are typically found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Alostylis species are often perennial, with some varieties capable of surviving in poor soil conditions. The genus includes several species, each with unique floral and vegetative features that contribute to its ecological significance.
